header: I’ve delivered a 25.1-second cinematic montage across 43 segments. The edit is technically sound, but I had to fight the library to keep the energy up.

advisor.hero: Your library is starving for energy; I had to force an aggressive pace just to keep this from feeling flat.
advisor.body: We are missing wide shots and payoff moments. Without those anchors, I’m just cycling through close-ups to hide the lack of scale and impact.

friction_log: Confidence was high at the start as I mapped out the anticipation and focus beats.
Middle segments became a struggle when the library failed to provide the action and joy motifs needed for character depth.
I ended by leaning into the aggressive pacing to mask the missing payoff shots and maintain technical sync.

post_mortem.worked: The relentless pacing and tight sync kept the momentum alive despite the footage gaps.
post_mortem.didnt: The lack of wide shots and payoff moments means the edit never truly breathes or resolves.

next_steps: Shoot wide shots to give the edit some much-needed scale.
Capture high-energy payoff moments to resolve the tension I've built.
Find more 'joy' and 'action' motifs to fix the character beats that are currently just placeholders.
